page.title: 01Wetwang,Gazeteer
page.content: This is an{agricultural area,mainly{arable}with some{sheep and {beef}farming. Wetwang is a{small village}in the East Yorkshire Wolds. The{population}numbers approximately{600}and these live in Main Street,Northfield Road,Southfield Road,Thorndale Croft,Weeton Drive and a few other small lanes. There are two{churches}:a modern Methodist church (St.Paul's),and a Norman,largely restored,C.ofE. parish church,(St.Nicholas). At the top right hand corner of this area is a very large{monument built in{1867}in memory of{Sir Tatton {Sykes}.Fine views of the surrounding area are obtainable from here. Approximately half a mile east of Wetwang is a large{archeological site of a{Bronze Age burial ground.
